result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program AFTER 4 years Initial Confinement.
Apply 185 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Buy money, Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  Buy Money is to be paid/forwarded to the City of Waukesha Police Department.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles E Jackson in court, in custody, with attorney James T Moczydlowski.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 4 and 5.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1, 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  The Court orders a presentence investigation report be prepared and filed with the Court in 30 days.  The Court sets the matter for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.
NOTE: 1/8/16 - at sentencing hearing the Court advises the minutes from this hearing should have reflected the repeater was stricken on counts #4 and #5.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
